intro: Eriocaulon angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved spikerush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of tiny, spike-like flowers that are typically green to brown in color. It thrives in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Eriocaulon angustifolium is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic habitats.
